intro: Stachytarpheta longespicata var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long pedicellate blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple inflorescences that resemble mist. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
